bow: so my friend implied need to discipline my child feeling weird about it my husband and are close friends with couple our age we have son who is year and half they have watched our son couple times and we babysit their kids quite bit well my husband has been worried recently that our son will try to swat at us when he frustrated and that we aren disciplining our son enough last night he asked his friend about his honest opinion about what he thinks he said he had to pry it out of him but basically that his wife my close friend said that she was surprised that when she watched my son that he would flop around when he was mad and that she thought could be doing more to discipline him and that she was surprised he acts like that was honestly bit hurt by that comment mainly because wish she could have spoken to me about it also feel when our kids are playing together my son is respectful with sharing toys and how he acts it seems like the children play well together of course there are normal behaviors like my son will be upset if he sees food and can have it or her daughter will be possessive over her toys but he is normally very docile child heard this from multiple people when he stressed out when leave him somewhere he does start to freak out bit don really know what can even do about this and feel frustrated about the whole thing don want to be one of those parents who don accept any advice but at the same time feel like need to make sure that the advice take is coming from the right place do plan on making sure follow through every time he tries to hit and let him know it not acceptable guess just needed to vent people are always going to judge you on how you parent but don change what you think is right just from one snarky comment yeah know just kinda sucks how this comment was from close friend of mine but that life guess ooooohhhh girl have had this exact experience some people have ridiculous standard for children just blow them off and make sweet comments about the science of development you decide do you need to discipline your child if they can understand the situation then you should require appropriate behavior this will teach them about the world and they will be happy people are always gon na have opinions you can have yours and not even worry about what she thinks my child does the exact same thing just walk away from him when he does it tell her that she can just walk away too tell her that your child is determined person and you will mold and shape it into positive ambition pray she has child with more spirit some day so she can get off her high horse and leave it at that source behavioral therapist specializing in early intervention with children one of the hardest things my husband and have had to learn is to parent for our kids and not for other people we want our kids to live up to our expectations not other peoples we don need them to behave like our friends kids as long as they re behaving the way we want them to behave our friends parent their kids in their way and it works for them guess we parent in our way and it works for us my in laws think my year old son should be quieter and less physical and less stubborn they think we should scold him more and probably spank him though they haven said it they are wrong for few reasons my son personality is very different from my husband their only child what worked for them will not work for us scolding and beating both just make my son behavior worse most of the time we don have problem with the way my son behaves they do won change my expectations of him just because they re around refuse to parent the way they want me to will parent the way my son needs me to and the way am comfortable with it sounds like your friend is being judgey because you aren disciplining the way she is and or your kid isn acting the way hers is neither of those are your problem they are both her problems even if you were disciplining him more there no guarantee his behavior would be any different and her kids might not be little angels because of something she doing it may just be that they were born that way you are right to feel hurt by her judgement but don for one second question your parenting understand that you might feel little off or maybe embarassed about her comment but remember that your husband was the one that was prying it out of them her your husband is clearly sharing the same feelings so would let this ruin or come in between your friendship yes that good point yeah this post is hard since hubby pried for their opinion know it can still sting though op even though they said how they would parent you guys are the parents you can let others opinions make you question what you re doing asking for help or advice we ll just take it with grain of salt thanks for your words this was an encouragement to me for sure and now don feel like suck at this whole parenting thing haha yes thank you children are individuals and different ways work for different children really admire your confidence and am wanting to build up my own with parenting think part of why my husband is having self doubt in parenting is from his lack of confidence so he tries to get reassurance and advice from our friends who have different standard hope your in laws and you can see more eye to eye one day know that can be rough do think there is anything wrong discussing the parenting of others confidentially with your spouse we do it all the time both what we like and also what we do differently helps us be confident we are doing what is right for us and be unified in our parenting method but we also know there are 23 hours of the day we do see the child do ca say what is best that that family therefore we would never tell anyone else how to parent unless they truely asked our opinion it sounds like this was the case of your friend assume it was something like would handle that differently and not op is terrible parent not feel annoyed at your friend for talking to her spouse about parenting methods she had observed if you do want her opinion bring it up with her if not move on you know your child best yes good point want to be person who is open to advice after all that how people grow but still have my own standard of what right for our son also the wife didn even want the husband to tell my husband this is something he ended up telling my husband one on one after he wanted his honest opinion so it really an awkward situation that will try to learn from removed good way of thinking of the situation thank you think that it normal behavior for child your sons age but it is behavior that has to be addressed it sounds like you re doing that kids go through stages of being tough in different areas at his age it also pretty normal to have separation anxiety so that could be the freaking out that you re experiencing all in all think asking friends honest opinion can be great thing because you can be there when you re not there if that makes sense you need to know how your team is doing in the game my dad always said that at home is practice and in public is game time so while realize it can hurt little bit it not all bad either if you think it something you all should work on then do it but you have no way of knowing unless someone tells you wouldn be embarrassed by it in the least even if he is acting out little bit kids do that it totally normal you re doing great your concern shows you re good mom understand it upsetting but your husband asked for opinions and seemingly had to press hard to get them so he you need to be prepared to hear opinions what you then do with those opinions is up to you and your husband you do need to take them on board at all gt you can let others opinions make you question what you re doing why not the second part of that was take it with grain of salt meaning there are million opinions out there if all of them made you feel bad how would you know what to do not saying be closed off to opinions just don let them rule your life you can please everyone feel for you just know that they re using their own kids as measuring stick so it really subjective what works for theirs does necessarily work for yours ve had my opinions about my friends rambunctious toddler boys while had an angelic infant girl and know was on the other end of it when few years later my chaotic four year old girl interacted with their boys who grew into well behaved grade schoolers it eventually seeks it own level and sooner than you think you ll all be lot more sympathetic because as parents you ve both seen all of the good and all of the worst it totally normal behavior though each kid is different so maybe your friends didn see it in their kids and were taken by surprise or maybe they tried to discipline it out of their kids my daughter did the same type of thing she swat and do stuff like that when she got frustrated she eventually grew our of it she now with year old you can set rules and boundaries but they take long while for them to sink in and for them to listen and act according to the rules if you discipline them too young they can yet connect the punishment to what they did wrong they see it as separate events so say don be too hard on him you can definitely tell him not to hit and that he needs to be patient and listen that ll help him obey when he tiny bit older it like sowing seeds but just let him be sometimes and when he hurting people just lead him away from the situation as it is happening don make big fuss but that just my thoughts go with ur gut your son sounds like normal toddler if her kids never flopped around or got angry at that age well shrug lucky her guess but there is no magic punishment for baby as long as you don go out of your way to reward the behavior he will outgrow it and move on to the next phase removed what does that even mean anyway what does she want you to do yell at him time out say no and spray him with water bottle he upset he ca have thing he responds by getting upset and flopping because he ca have thing this is normal and healthy because being upset is valid and real emotion if you were to discipline him he not old enough to understand what you want is for them to express frustration differently and the worst possible outcome is you end up teaching him it not ok to be upset and then he grows up to have anger issues and an inability to process frustration mean do think it good thing to address in way that validates your toddler emotions see you re upset because you ca have thing that must be difficult not give in or distract just validate and say hey see you anyway feel you and be upset too because different babies have different temperaments and reactions to things as they develop there no one method to rule them all you definitely need to be doing something consistent to address your son hitting and temper tantrums they re totally normal and not sign that you re doing anything wrong but you and your husband should have consistent strategy which at his age we use either gentle correction hands are not for hitting is great book or removing from the situation in not fun not engaging way it sounds like your friend was pushed into admitting some frustrations which she was totally prepared to ignore as normal parenting differences normal toddler behavior it perfectly reasonable to feel weird and uncomfortable hearing that it your choice what you do to address that would recommend asking your husband what he thinks you should be doing about hitting tantrums and deciding on united strategy for addressing them next time your toddler does something inappropriate with your friends around follow that strategy and then tell your friends that you re doing and to address the behavior if it comes up while they re babysitting woah he 18 months has everyone lost their mind you ca dicipline in they way sure it meant an 18 month old they are still learning if fact they literally just learned how to predict repetitive behaviors think hitting and flopping on the ground are totally normal behavior it not the worst thing that you know how people feel because you can use it to judge their actions but think you need to take anything said in future with grain of salt my mind is actually blown that this something anyone commented about its not bad idea to figure out early what you plan to do for creating structured response to bad behavior but even if you implemented something this is way to young to see much effect we are doing magic with my year old started at but you do use it to control emotions at this age the hitting is spontaneous not calculated and the flopping is like whole body extreme anger sadness they ca really control their emotions yet why would anyone think this behavior is atypical less frustrated on your behalf because of that the friends said but you need to get your husband on the same page her should know what reasonable normal behavior is at every age pretty skeptical about the idea of disciplining an 18 month old discipline punishment consequences all much of muchness and you have to tread carefully imo http www janetlansbury com 2013 07 truths about consequences think your son is acting completely normally for an 18 month old who is experiencing up because it was my first thought 18 months is tricky as your sweet cooperative baby starting moving into the testing toddler years couldn agree you more and op and hubby need to get on the same page about what to when inappropriate behavior starts happen magic is excellent lucky that my mom was very thoughtful parent and we have close relationship so when tell her things about my parenting or ask her questions she reinforces that what doing is right for my kid my husband does the same as yours looks for validation and advice elsewhere mostly it validation he wants everyone to think we are good parents so he gets nervous if our kids aren meeting someone else expectations it especially difficult with his parents for obvious reasons but luckily his parents are good at listening so when finally got sick of their comments and explained that my son is different than their son and told them what discipline method we are using they ve pretty much shut up ve been the friend that bitched to my spouse about his friend parenting in my defense the kid was and threw my son on the ground and kicked him and gave him bloody nose on his first birthday so justified imo and she has gotten much better about being on top of her son when he around mine and preventing any injuries even if do still think she lets him get away with far too much but at the end of the day it not like she came at you and accused you of being shitty parent she mentioned to her husband in private about difference in the way you parent and your husband dragged it out of her husband it sounds to me more like husband not seeing eye to eye with you about parenting issue than friend issue he already felt some way and went looking for back up or was worried you guys weren handling something right and sought advice from people he considers good parents before even trying to talk to you about it he probably should have discussed the issue with you first before he went seeking backup that pretty shitty way of bringing perceived issue to your attention that said your kid is 18 months old not discipline is not gon na be super effective at that age found it much more helpful to start talking to my son about emotions at that age hey buddy do you wan na talk about it can see that you re sad angry disappointed because of and so sorry that happened etc also daniel tiger is actually great for teaching emotional how to feel about the friend saying that when op husband insisted but this sounds kind of normal for an 18 month old yes plan on addressing when our son tries to hit us don want that to progress what professional about techniques if you re having mistaken behaviours from you lo there are lot of resources and your ped should be able to connect you to reliable sources look into magda gerber it crazy at this age far more harmful then helpful for budding toddler removed yeah this stings bit we always wan na feel like others especially friends respect our parenting because seriously we are always doing our best it hurts to get feedback like this it kind of reminds me of what my pediatrician told me took my daughter to the pediatrician when she had tummy bug she was upset and took little swat at me and our md saw he said it happens all the time but to say no no or no hitting quite sternly he said if applied this tiny amount of discipline now she wouldn be little tyrant at lol honestly it stung to hear that felt embarrassed at first it like can get some credit for all the other stuff do pls but did what he said and she hasn been swatting out of anger anymore so get it and right there with you mama stay strong and try not to take it personally just thought of it as little course correction and now no more swatting so actually it has helped and remember even amazing moms like you and me can benefit from little course corrections if we open our hearts to it and don take it personally good luck and good job mama came here to say this we do time outs but not much more because that all he can handle that it to say wo give more age appropriate and serious consequences in months time and beyond yeah with the top commenter try not to judge her you re getting this quote third hand unless read wrong and we re all guilty of saying things off the cuff that we may not have thought that much in depth about the husband should not have repeated his wife words to your husband sure she is mortified—if he told her and if he even got what she meant correct basically try your darndest to let it go though know it would be super hard for me too focus instead on how your husband is concerned with your kids behavior try not to change anything because of what anyone thinks but you and your husband it bit unfair to say these people are on their high horse when they were asked for opinions and very reluctantly gave it obviously her own husband is concerned about it so maybe more can be done these friends are not out of line for answering question honestly especially given that they do have experience parenting and were pressured into giving their opinion it one thing to have reasonably expectations of child for their age and another to make excuses the hard part is finding the balance no one wants to be told how to parent but when multiple people around you are telling you that your child is being excessively difficult and that they are seeing boundaries being given it okay to take some time for introspection it dicey subject no matter how you approach it because we see our parenting as reflection of ourselves and feel like failures if there is any kind of criticism that why it is important to try to keep an open mind and learning attitude because none of us are perfect and everyday is new challenge am the mother of 17 month old biter my son acts the way that yours does but instead of swatting he bites it very upsetting because he is such sweet and loving little boy was upset by his behavior so sat down with the director of the daycare who obviously knows way more about childhood behavior than do and talked about it she assured me over and over again that this is totally normal behavior at this age at this age kids get frustrated because they can not communicate and this is their way of doing it the print outs she gave me on the subject we re very clear that the only thing we can do about it until about years old is be patient do make big deal about it and instead of discipline we need to show him more acceptable ways to act when we see him acting that way they said this will be long phase but it does not indicate their future behavior meaning this does not mean he will be bad or mean kid in the future it communication problem not behavior problem and not our fault yeah can get on board with that guess didn catch that they had asked you re borrowing trouble here your friend made comment to her husband and your husband pried that comment out of him despite the fact that he didn want to share it only because your husband had similar concern—and her comment was phrased as gently as possible that she was surprised your son acted certain way—and yet you still seem upset with her and about the situation and are defensively explaining why her opinion is wrong is it any wonder she didn tell you directly you seem very sensitive to perceived criticism and giving unsolicited feedback to people who respond that way is not rewarding task and is not likely to strengthen relationship leave her out of it and focus on working with your husband to hear his perception since he seems to feel your son might be under disciplined
